properties.name: text-decoration-line
properties.value: none | [ underline || overline || line-through || blink ] | spelling-error | grammar-error

values.name: none
values.prose: Neither produces nor inhibits text decoration.

values.name: underline
values.prose: Each line of text is underlined.

values.name: overline
values.prose: Each line of text has a line over it (i.e. on the opposite side from an underline).

values.name: line-through
values.prose: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

values.name: blink
values.prose: The text blinks (alternates between visible and invisible). Conforming user agents may simply not blink the text. Note that not blinking the text is one technique to satisfy checkpoint 3.3 of WAI-UAAG. This value is deprecated in favor of Animations [CSS3-ANIMATIONS].

values.name: spelling-error
values.prose: This value indicates the type of text decoration used by the user agent to highlight spelling mistakes. Its appearance is UA-defined, and may be platform-dependent.

values.name: grammar-error
values.prose: This value indicates the type of text decoration used by the user agent to highlight grammar mistakes. Its appearance is UA defined, and may be platform-dependent.

values.name: wavy
values.prose: Values have the same meaning as for the border-style properties [CSS-BACKGROUNDS-3]. wavy indicates a wavy line.

values.name: auto
values.prose: The UA chooses an appropriate thickness for text decoration lines; see below.

values.name: from-font
values.prose: If the first available font has metrics indicating a preferred underline width, use that width, otherwise behaves as auto.

values.name: <length>
values.prose: Specifies the thickness of text decoration lines as a fixed length. The UA should round the actual value to the nearest integer device pixel, and ensure it is at least one device pixel.

values.name: <percentage>
values.prose: Specifies the thickness of text decoration lines as a percentage of 1em. The UA should round the actual value to the nearest integer device pixel, and ensure it is at least one device pixel.

values.name: auto
values.prose: The user agent may use any algorithm to determine the underline’s position; however it must be placed at or under the alphabetic baseline. A typical “alphabetic” underline is positioned just below the alphabetic baseline

values.name: from-font
values.prose: If the first available font has metrics indicating a preferred underline offset, use that offset, otherwise behaves as auto.

values.name: under
values.prose: The underline is positioned under the element’s text content. In this case the underline usually does not cross the descenders. (This is sometimes called “accounting” underline.) This value can be combined with left or right if a particular side is preferred in vertical typographic modes. text-underline-position: under Because text-underline-position inherits, and is not reset by the text-decoration shorthand, the following example switches the document to use under underlining, which can be more appropriate for writing systems with long, complicated descenders. It is also often useful for mathematical or chemical texts that use many subscripts. :root { text-underline-position: under; }

values.name: left
values.prose: In vertical typographic modes, the underline is aligned as for under, except it is always aligned to the left edge of the text. If this causes the underline to be drawn on the "over" side of the text, then an overline also switches sides and is drawn on the "under" side.

values.name: right
values.prose: In vertical typographic modes, the underline is aligned as for under, except it is always aligned to the right edge of the text. If this causes the underline to be drawn on the "over" side of the text, then an overline also switches sides and is drawn on the "under" side.

values.name: auto
values.prose: The UA chooses an appropriate offset for underlines. However, this offset must be zero if the computed value of text-underline-position is from-font and the UA was able to extract an appropriate metric to use from the font.

values.name: <length>
values.prose: Specifies the offset of underlines as a fixed length.

values.name: <percentage>
values.prose: Specifies the offset of underlines as a percentage of 1em.

values.name: none
values.prose: The text-decoration-skip property and its sub-properties (text-decoration-skip-self, text-decoration-skip-box, text-decoration-skip-inset, text-decoration-skip-spaces, text-decoration-skip-ink) control interruptions in line decorations for which the element or an ancestor is the decorating box. The none value sets all sub-properties to none, and the auto value sets all sub-properties to their initial values.

values.name: auto
values.prose: The text-decoration-skip property and its sub-properties (text-decoration-skip-self, text-decoration-skip-box, text-decoration-skip-inset, text-decoration-skip-spaces, text-decoration-skip-ink) control interruptions in line decorations for which the element or an ancestor is the decorating box. The none value sets all sub-properties to none, and the auto value sets all sub-properties to their initial values.

properties.name: text-decoration-skip-self
properties.value: auto | skip-all | [ skip-underline || skip-overline || skip-line-through ] | no-skip
properties.computedValue: specified keyword(s) except for skip-all, see below

values.name: auto
values.prose: Skip this element (its entire margin box) if it is an atomic inline (such as an image or inline-block).

values.name: skip-all
values.prose: Skip this element (its entire margin box) unconditionally. Don’t draw across it, don’t propagate to it.

values.name: skip-underline
values.prose: Skip this element (its entire margin box) unconditionally when drawing ancestor underlines.

values.name: skip-overline
values.prose: Skip this element (its entire margin box) unconditionally when drawing ancestor overlines.

values.name: skip-line-through
values.prose: Skip this element (its entire margin box) unconditionally when drawing ancestor line-throughs.

values.name: no-skip
values.prose: Line decorations from ancestor decorating boxes are applied to this box unconditionally: drawn across it as if it were text if it is an atomic inline, or propagated to it according to the usual rules if it is not.

values.name: none
values.prose: Skip nothing: line decorations from ancestor decorating boxes are drawn from margin edge to margin edge.

values.name: all
values.prose: When drawing text decoration lines applied to an ancestor decorating box, skip over the box’s own margin, border, and padding areas and only draw line decorations within its content area. This value only has an effect for decorations imposed by an ancestor; a decorating box never draws over its own box decoration.

values.name: none
values.prose: Spacers are not skipped. They are decorated just like any other character.

values.name: all
values.prose: Skip all spacers and all word separators plus any adjacent letter-spacing or word-spacing.

values.name: start
values.prose: Skip all spacers, plus any adjacent letter-spacing or word-spacing, when located at the start of the line.

values.name: end
values.prose: Skip all spacers, plus any adjacent letter-spacing or word-spacing, when located at the end of the line.

values.name: auto
values.prose: UAs may interrupt underlines and overlines where the line would cross glyph ink and to some distance to either side of the glyph outline. UAs should consider the script of the text (see note below) when determining whether to apply ink-skipping behavior to a given range of content.

values.name: all
values.prose: UAs must interrupt underlines and overlines where the line would cross glyph ink and to some distance to either side of the glyph outline.

values.name: none
values.prose: UA must draw continuous underlines and overlines, without interruptions when they cross over a glyph.

properties.name: text-emphasis-style
properties.value: none | [ [ filled | open ] || [ dot | circle | double-circle | triangle | sesame ] ] | <string>
properties.computedValue: the keyword none, a pair of keywords representing the shape and fill, or a string

values.name: none
values.prose: No emphasis marks.

values.name: filled
values.prose: The shape is filled with solid color.

values.name: dot
values.prose: Display small circles as marks. The filled dot is U+2022 '•', and the open dot is U+25E6 '◦'.

values.name: circle
values.prose: Display large circles as marks. The filled circle is U+25CF '●', and the open circle is U+25CB '○'.

values.name: double-circle
values.prose: Display double circles as marks. The filled double-circle is U+25C9 '◉', and the open double-circle is U+25CE '◎'.

values.name: triangle
values.prose: Display triangles as marks. The filled triangle is U+25B2 '▲', and the open triangle is U+25B3 '△'.

values.name: sesame
values.prose: Display sesames as marks. The filled sesame is U+FE45 '﹅', and the open sesame is U+FE46 '﹆'.

values.name: <string>
values.prose: Display the given string as marks. Authors should not specify more than one character in <string>. The UA may truncate or ignore strings consisting of more than one grapheme cluster.

values.name: over
values.prose: Draw marks over the text in horizontal typographic modes.

values.name: under
values.prose: Draw marks under the text in horizontal typographic modes.

values.name: right
values.prose: Draw marks to the right of the text in vertical typographic modes.

values.name: left
values.prose: Draw marks to the left of the text in vertical typographic modes.

values.name: spaces
values.prose: Skip word separators or other characters belonging to the Unicode separator category (Z*). (But note that emphasis marks are drawn for a space that combines with any combining characters.)

values.name: punctuation
values.prose: Skip punctuation. Punctuation in this definition includes characters belonging to the Unicode P* category that are not defined as symbols (see below).

values.name: symbols
values.prose: Skip symbols. Symbols in this definition includes all typographic character units belonging to the Unicode S* general category as well as any which are NFKD-equivalent [UAX15] to the following characters from the Unicode Po category: # U+0023 NUMBER SIGN % U+0025 PERCENT SIGN ‰ U+2030 PER MILLE SIGN ‱ U+2031 PER TEN THOUSAND SIGN ٪ U+066A ARABIC PERCENT SIGN ؉ U+0609 ARABIC-INDIC PER MILLE SIGN ؊ U+060A ARABIC-INDIC PER TEN THOUSAND SIGN & U+0026 AMPERSAND ⁊ U+204A TIRONIAN SIGN E[[ @ U+0040 COMMERCIAL AT § U+00A7 SECTION SIGN ¶ U+00B6 PILCROW SIGN ⁋ U+204B REVERSED PILCROW SIGN ⁓ U+2053 SWUNG DASH 〽️ U+303D PART ALTERNATION MARK

values.name: narrow
values.prose: Skip characters where the East_Asian_Width property [UAX11] of the Unicode database [UAX44] is not F (Fullwidth) or W (Wide).

properties.name: text-shadow
properties.computedValue: either the keyword none or a list, each item consisting of four absolute lengths plus a computed color and optionally also an inset keyword

warnings.name: <length>
warnings.prose: Inset (positive) or outset (negative) the start/end of the affected line decorations. The following example offsets an extra thick underline 1em endwards with respect to the text h1 { text-decoration: underline 0.3em rgba(36,148,187,0.25); text-decoration-trim: 1em -1em; }

warnings.name: auto
warnings.prose: The UA chooses a trim amount that ensures that if two identical underlined elements appear side-by-side they do not appear to have a single underline. (This is important in Chinese, where underlining is a form of punctuation.) text-decoration-skip-inset: auto for <u>石井</u><u>艾俐俐</u>
